title: Phone & Video Call Basics
objectives: फ़ोन या वीडियो कॉल के दौरान बुनियादी इंग्लिश वाक्यों में सहज होना
Incoming और outgoing कॉल में greetings, identity confirm करना सीखना
5-Step Toolkit के जरिए कॉल की शुरुआत, जानकारी शेयर करना, समस्या समाधान और अंत करना
हिंदी-अंग्रेज़ी मिश्रित अंदाज़ में अनेक real-world call scenarios में आत्मविश्वास पाना

activities.text: नमस्ते! आज हम सीखेंगे ‘Phone & Video Call Basics.’ कई लोग फ़ोन पर इंग्लिश में घबरा जाते हैं, इसलिए हमने बनाया है एक आसान 5-Step Toolkit. इससे आप confidently कॉल शुरू, जारी, और ख़त्म कर पाएँगे!

activities.title: 5-Step Phone/Video Call Toolkit
activities.body:
1) **Greeting & Opening** – ‘Hello, this is ___.’
2) **Purpose** – ‘I’m calling about ___.’ या ‘Could you help me with ___?’
3) **Ask & Clarify** – ‘Could you speak louder?’, ‘Could you confirm ___?’
4) **Tech Issues / Wrong No.** – ‘You’re breaking up’, ‘I think this is a wrong number.’
5) **Close Politely** – ‘Thanks for your time, bye!’

हर कॉल में यही 5 steps दोहराएँ—चाहे डॉक्टर को कॉल हो या दोस्त को!

activities.question: कॉल या वीडियो कॉल में आपको सबसे challenging कौन-सा Step लगता है?

dynamicFeedback.2: Say: ‘Could you explain that again?’, ‘Could you speak slower?’
dynamicFeedback.3: Tell them: ‘You’re breaking up. Let’s reconnect.’
dynamicFeedback.4: End with: ‘Thanks for your help. Take care!’

activities.text: Toolkit सरल है: Greeting से कॉल शुरू, फिर सामने वाले को अपना मक़सद बताते हैं, पूछताछ या clarify करना हो तो करते हैं, tech issue या गलत नंबर हो तो politely handle करें, और अंत में call close करें. अब real-life scenarios देखें!

activities.sentence: Hello, ______ (this is / you are) Riya. I’m calling about my flight booking.
hints: ‘This is Riya’ — correct way to identify yourself
‘You are Riya’ sounds like you're telling them who they are!

feedback.correctText: सही! Step 1 (Greeting & Opening) में यही phrasing सही है.
feedback.wrongText: ‘You are Riya’ contextually गलत—आप कॉलर हैं, अपना नाम बता रहे हैं!

activities.caption: Network issue? कहें: ‘Sorry, you’re breaking up. Can I call you back?’

scenes.text:
**Scenario #1: Hospital (Appointment / Emergency)**

1) Greeting: “Hello, this is Priya speaking.”
2) Purpose: “I’d like to book an appointment with Dr. Mehta for tomorrow.”
3) Ask: “Could you tell me if he’s available in the morning?”
4) Tech Issues/Wrong No.: If line is unclear: ‘You’re breaking up, could you repeat?’
5) Close: “Alright, thank you for your help. Goodbye!”

अचानक इमरजेंसी हो तो: “It’s urgent. Could I speak to Dr. Mehta right away?”

**Key Learning**: Be direct if urgent, but always polite.

cards.definition:
“I’d like to book an appointment with Dr. ___.”
Use when you have a planned visit.

“It’s urgent. Could you connect me immediately?”
Use short lines, emphasize urgency.

“Could you tell me the visiting hours?”
When you need specific slot/time info.

scenes.text:
**Scenario #2: Restaurant (Table Booking)**

1) Greeting: “Hello, may I speak to the reservation desk?”
2) Purpose: “I’m calling to book a table for 4 at 8 PM tonight.”
3) Ask: “Could you confirm if there’s a non-smoking section?”
4) Tech Issues: If they ask ‘Who’s calling?’ → ‘This is Rakesh.’
5) Close: “Thanks! See you tonight, bye.”

**Key Learning**: State your desired time/size. Then confirm any preference (like non-smoking).

cards.definition:
“Hello, I'd like to book a table for __.”
Used to specify time & number of people.
“Could we have a window seat?” या “Is it a non-smoking area?”

“Thanks, see you at 8 PM!”
Always restate time to avoid confusion.

scenes.text:
**Scenario #3: Friend (Casual)**

1) Greeting: “Hey Amit, how have you been?”
2) Purpose: “I’m calling to see if you’re free this weekend.”
3) Ask: “Could we catch up for coffee on Sunday?”
4) Tech Issue: If mic is low: ‘Could you speak louder?’
5) Close: “Okay, see you soon. Take care!”

**Key Learning**: Casual tone, friendly vibe. Perfect for personal calls.

cards.definition: “Hey, how’ve you been?” ‘Hey buddy, long time!’

“Are you free on ___?”
‘Do you want to meet up for coffee?’

“Alright, talk soon!”
Keep it cheerful, not abrupt.

scenes.text:
**Scenario #4: Customer Care / Bank**

1) Greeting: “Hello, this is Rohit. I have a query about my account.”
2) Purpose: “I’d like to check my recent transaction.”
3) Ask: “Could you confirm the amount credited?”
4) Issue: If line is unclear, “Sorry, could you repeat that?”
5) Close: “Thank you for your help, have a great day!”

**Key Learning**: Be clear and to-the-point with official calls.

cards.definition: “Hello, this is ___. I have a query about ___.”

“Could you confirm ___?”
‘Could you help me with __?’

scenes.text:
**Scenario #5: Travel Agent (Booking Tickets)**

1) Greeting: “Good morning, is this Sky Travels?”
2) Purpose: “I want to book a flight ticket for next Friday.”
3) Ask: “Could you tell me the timings and fares?”
4) Tech Issue: If put on hold, “Sure, I can wait.”
5) Close: “That’s all, thanks for your assistance! Bye.”

**Key Learning**: Mention your date, ask for details (cost, timings).

cards.definition:
“Hello, is this [Agency Name]?”
Confirm you dialed the right place.

“I need to book a flight for next Friday.”
Clearly specify date/destination.

“Could you share the timings and fare?”
Ask for clarity so you can decide.

activities.title: Lesson 11 Recap
activities.body:
### 5-Step Toolkit Recap
1) Greeting & Opening: ‘Hello, this is ___.’
2) Purpose: ‘I’m calling about ___.’
3) Ask/Clarify: ‘Could you confirm ___?’ ‘Could you speak louder?’
4) Tech/Stranger: ‘You’re breaking up.’ ‘Wrong number?’
5) Close Politely: ‘Thanks for your help, bye!’

आपके सामने कितने भी scenarios आएँ—बस यह 5-Step pattern याद रखिये!
